# G-Rump Quick Start Guide

**Get from 0 to working in 5 minutes.**

## The 3 Modes

### 1. Quick Start (Mock Mode) ‚≠ê RECOMMENDED
**Perfect for:** First-time users, UI exploration, offline development

```bash
npm run setup:interactive
# ‚Üí Choose "Quick Start" (option 1)
# ‚Üí No API keys needed!

npm run dev
# ‚Üí Opens http://localhost:5173
```

**What you get:**
- ‚úì Full UI with simulated AI responses
- ‚úì All features visible and explorable
- ‚úì Zero configuration
- ‚úì Perfect for learning the interface

**Limitation:** AI responses are realistic placeholders (not generated by real AI)

---

### 2. Development Mode
**Perfect for:** Active development, testing real AI

```bash
npm run setup:interactive
# ‚Üí Choose "Development" (option 2)
# ‚Üí Add at least one API key when prompted

npm run dev
```

**What you get:**
- ‚úì Real AI-generated responses
- ‚úì Choose which features to enable
- ‚úì Debug logging enabled
- ‚úì Hot reload for rapid iteration

**Required:** At least one AI provider API key

---

### 3. Production Mode
**Perfect for:** Deploying to users

```bash
npm run setup:interactive
# ‚Üí Choose "Production" (option 3)
# ‚Üí Full security configuration

npm run build
npm run start:prod
```

---

## Next Steps by Role

### üë®‚Äçüíª Frontend Developer
1. Start with **Quick Start** mode
2. Explore the UI components in `frontend/src/components/`
3. Read `docs/frontend-dev.md`
4. Try modifying a Svelte component
5. See the changes instantly with hot reload

**Key files:**
- `frontend/src/App.svelte` - Main app shell
- `frontend/src/components/ChatInterface.svelte` - Chat UI
- `frontend/src/stores/` - State management

### ‚öôÔ∏è Backend Developer
1. Start with **Quick Start** mode
2. Explore API in `backend/src/routes/`
3. Read `docs/backend-dev.md`
4. Add a new route in `backend/src/routes/my-feature.ts`
5. Test with `curl http://localhost:3000/api/my-feature`

**Key files:**
- `backend/src/routes/` - API endpoints
- `backend/src/services/` - Business logic
- `backend/src/tools/` - AI tool definitions

### ü§ñ AI/ML Developer
1. Start with **Development** mode + API key
2. Explore prompts in `backend/src/prompts/`
3. Read `docs/AI_WORKFLOWS.md`
4. Modify a system prompt
5. Test the response changes

**Key files:**
- `backend/src/prompts/` - System prompts
- `backend/src/agents/` - Agent definitions
- `packages/ai-core/` - Model router

### üìã Product Manager
1. Start with **Quick Start** mode
2. Try all 3 modes: Chat, Architecture, Ship
3. Read `docs/CAPABILITIES.md`
4. Use Architecture mode to generate diagrams from requirements
5. Export PRDs and share with team

**Features to try:**
- **Chat Mode:** Ask questions, get code help
- **Architecture Mode:** Describe a system, get diagrams
- **Ship Mode:** Get deployment configs

---

## Common First Tasks

### 1. Send your first message
```
1. Open http://localhost:5173
2. Type "Hello! What can you do?"
3. See the response (mock or real depending on mode)
```

### 2. Generate architecture
```
1. Click "Architecture" mode
2. Type "Design a blog system with users, posts, and comments"
3. Watch the diagram generate in real-time
4. Export as Mermaid or PNG
```

### 3. Create a custom agent
```typescript
// See docs/examples/100-lines.md for copy-paste examples
```

### 4. Deploy something
```
1. Click "Ship" mode
2. Type "Deploy to Docker with health checks"
3. Get production-ready Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml
```

---

## Feature Toggles

Control what runs without deleting code:

```bash
# In backend/.env
MOCK_AI_MODE=true        # Use mock responses (no API key)
DISABLE_RAG=true         # Turn off document search
DISABLE_VOICE=true       # Turn off voice features
FRONTEND_ONLY=true       # Skip backend, use external API
SHOW_ONBOARDING_TOUR=true # Show guided tour on first run
```

---

## Troubleshooting

**Problem:** `Error: At least one AI provider API key is required`
**Solution:** Either:
- Run `npm run setup:interactive` and choose Quick Start
- Or set `MOCK_AI_MODE=true` in `backend/.env`

**Problem:** White screen on Electron
**Solution:** 
- Make sure backend is running: `npm run dev:backend`
- Check console for errors: Ctrl+Shift+I

**Problem:** Changes not showing
**Solution:**
- Frontend auto-reloads
- Backend needs restart: Ctrl+C then `npm run dev:backend`

**More help:** See `docs/KNOWN_ISSUES.md`

---

## Learning Path

### Level 1: Explorer (5 minutes)
- [ ] Run Quick Start mode
- [ ] Send 3 messages in chat
- [ ] Generate 1 architecture diagram
- [ ] Explore the UI

### Level 2: User (30 minutes)
- [ ] Add a real API key
- [ ] Try all 3 modes with real AI
- [ ] Generate and export a PRD
- [ ] Read `docs/HOW_IT_WORKS.md`

### Level 3: Developer (2 hours)
- [ ] Modify a Svelte component
- [ ] Add a new API route
- [ ] Customize a system prompt
- [ ] Read `docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`

### Level 4: Expert (ongoing)
- [ ] Create a custom agent
- [ ] Add a new tool
- [ ] Contribute to the codebase
- [ ] Read all docs in `docs/`

---

## One-Line Commands

```bash
# Quick start everything
npm run setup:interactive && npm run dev

# Backend only
npm run dev:backend

# Frontend only
npm run dev:frontend

# Desktop app
cd frontend && npm run electron:dev

# Run tests
npm test

# Check everything works
npm run check-all
```
